intro: Stemmadenia macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved stemmadenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its robust, woody stems and large, elliptical leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
